'''Daximus ‘Dax’ Randall Shepard''' (born January 2, 1975) is an American actor, comedian, writer, and director. He is best known for his work in the feature films ''[[Without a Paddle]]'' (2004), ''[[Zathura: A Space Adventure]]'' (2005), ''[[Employee of the Month (2006 film)|Employee of the Month]]'' (2006), ''[[Idiocracy]]'' (2006), ''[[Let's Go to Prison]]'' (2006), ''[[Hit and Run (2012 film)|Hit and Run]]'' (2012), and ''[[CHiPs (film)|CHiPs]]'' (2017), the last pair of which he also wrote and directed, and the [[MTV]] practical joke reality series ''[[Punk'd]]'' (2003). He portrayed [[List of Parenthood characters#Crosby Braverman|Crosby Braverman]] in the [[NBC]] comedy-drama series ''[[Parenthood (2010 TV series)|Parenthood]]'' from 2010 to 2015.
== Early life == Shepard was born in [[Highland Township, Oakland County, Michigan]], in suburban [[Detroit]].<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014>{{cite web|last1=Maron|first1=Marc|title=Episode 533 – Dax Shepard|url=http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episodes/episode_533_-_dax_shepard|website=[[WTF with Marc Maron]]|format=Audio interview (podcast)|accessdate=September 20, 2014|date=September 15, 2014}}</ref> He is the son of Laura LaBo,<ref name=ChicagoTribune-CarFirm-1994>{{cite news|last1=Sammons|first1=Mary Beth|title=Car Firm Shows Off For Celebrities, Press |url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/1994-01-30/travel/9401300381_1_new-car-and-truck-shoots-vehicles|accessdate=September 20, 2014|work=[[Chicago Tribune]]|date=January 30, 1994}}</ref><ref name=Autoweek-HitandRun-2012>{{cite news|last1=Jewett|first1=Dale|title=Dax Shepard goes full throttle: Actor's hot-rod Lincoln, desert racer are stars in new movie|url=http://autoweek.com/article/car-news/dax-shepard-goes-full-throttle-actors-hot-rod-lincoln-desert-racer-are-stars-new|accessdate=September 21, 2014|work=[[Autoweek]]|date=July 11, 2012}}</ref> who worked at [[General Motors]] (GM), and Dave Robert Shepard, Sr. (deceased),<ref name=FamilySearch-SSDI-Father-2012>{{cite web|title=David R Shepard – United States Social Security Death Index|url=https://familysearch.org/pal:/MM9.1.1/KX3S-BFH|website=[[FamilySearch]]|accessdate=September 20, 2014|date=December 30, 2012}}</ref><ref name=DaxTumbler-Father-2013>{{cite web|last1=Shepard|first1=Dax|title=My Father's Horniness|url=http://daxtumbler.tumblr.com/post/45876994574/my-fathers-horniness|website=Don't Try: Dax Tumbler|accessdate=September 20, 2014|date=March 20, 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140924042326/http://daxtumbler.tumblr.com/post/45876994574/my-fathers-horniness|archivedate=September 24, 2014|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref name=HuffPo-Father-2013>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/03/22/dax-shepard-shares-emotio_n_2933457.html |title=Dax Shepard Writes Emotional Post About His Late Father And Kristen Bell (Photo) |work=[[Huffington Post]] |date=March 22, 2013 |accessdate=April 10, 2014}}</ref> who was a car salesman.<ref name=DaxTumbler-Father-2013 /><ref name=NZHerald-HitandRun-2012>{{cite web|title=Dax Shepard: Motor City hit and run man|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/entertainment/news/article.cfm?c_id=1501119&objectid=10831982|work=[[The New Zealand Herald]]|accessdate=October 30, 2013|date=September 6, 2012}}</ref> His parents divorced when he was 3 years old.<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 />
Shepard's mother ended up growing a huge business by the time he was in high school.<ref name=ChicagoTribune-CarFirm-1994 /> She worked car shows with traveling events at race tracks. She started as a janitor on the midnight shift at [[General Motors|GM]],<ref name=HReporter-AboutABoy-2014>{{cite news|last1=Turchiano|first1=Danielle|title=Dax Shepard Talks Directing 'About a Boy's' Take on 'A Christmas Carol'|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/dax-shepard-talks-directing-a-754771|accessdate=December 10, 2014|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=December 9, 2014}}</ref> then worked in fleet management at the GM proving grounds in [[Milford, Michigan|Milford]], Michigan, then hosted hospitality days for all the GM family members, eventually moving into [[public relations]] at an ad agency.<ref name=NZHerald-HitandRun-2012 /> She went back to GM, ending up owning four shops that managed publicity events for magazine journalists. From the age of 14 to 18, Shepard worked for his mother on the road, going from racetrack to racetrack.<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 /> For about 2 years, Shepard had a stepfather who was an engineer on the [[Chevrolet Corvette|Corvette]].<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 /><ref name=NZHerald-HitandRun-2012 /> Shepard's mother has been married four times—Shepard said he's had three stepfathers.<ref name=HowardStern-Freebie-2010>{{cite web|last1=Stern|first1=Howard|title=Thursday, September 16, 2010|url=http://www.howardstern.com/howard-on-air/howard-100-101/2010-09-16?mode=full|website=[[Howard Stern Show]]|accessdate=September 21, 2014|date=September 16, 2010}}</ref>
According to Shepard, his mother named him for the rich playboy Dax (Diogenes Alejandro Xenos), in [[Harold Robbins]]' novel ''The Adventurers''.<ref name=ComedyBangBang-2009>{{cite web|url=http://www.earwolf.com/episode/episode-9-chip-pope-dax-shepard-neil-hamburger-paul-f-tompkins|title=Comedy Death Ray Radio with Scott Aukerman – Episode 9 – Chip Pope, Dax Shepard, Neil Hamburger, Paul F. Tompkins|last=Aukerman|first=Scott|format=Audio interview (podcast)|date=June 26, 2009|work=[[Comedy Bang! Bang!]]|accessdate=December 17, 2010}}</ref> He has an older brother, David Shepard, who lives in Oregon,<ref name=DaxTumbler-Father-2013 /> and a younger half-sister, Carly Hatter,<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 /> whom he cast in his 2012 film ''[[Hit and Run (2012 film)|Hit and Run]]''.<ref name=People-Father-2013>{{cite web| url=http://celebritybabies.people.com/2013/07/28/dax-shepard-being-a-father-is-like-falling-in-love-for-the-first-time/|title=Dax Shepard: Being a Father Is Like Falling in Love for the First Time|date=July 28, 2013|last=Olya |first=Gabrielle|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|accessdate=July 28, 2013}}</ref><ref name=HitFix-HitandRun-2012>{{cite web|url=http://www.hitfix.com/awards-campaign/dax-shepard-gives-his-friends-a-career-showcase-in-hit-and-run|title=Dax Shepard gives his friends a career showcase in 'Hit and Run'|date=August 21, 2012|last=Ellwood |first=Gregory|work=[[HitFix]]|accessdate=July 28, 2013}}</ref>
Shepard has said that he was raised in Milford,<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 /> although he lived in a lot of places in suburban Detroit, growing up primarily in [[Walled Lake, Michigan]]. He graduated from [[Walled Lake Central High School]] in 1993<ref name=FoxDetroit-HitandRun-2012>{{cite web|title=Dax Shepard pays tribute to FOX 2 anchor in new movie|url=http://www.wmyt12.com/story/18980300/2012/07/09/dax-shepard-pays-tribute-to-fox-2-anchor-in-new-movie|work=[[WJBK]]|accessdate=November 30, 2013|date=July 9, 2012}}</ref> before enrolling in [[The Groundlings|The Groundlings school]].<ref name=Groundlings>{{cite web|title=Performers – Dax Shepard |url=http://groundlings.com/performers/performer-details.aspx?performerID=380 |work=[[The Groundlings]] |accessdate=November 30, 2013}}</ref> After attending [[Santa Monica College]] and [[West Los Angeles College]], Shepard transferred to [[University of California, Los Angeles|UCLA]], where he graduated ''[[magna cum laude]]'' with a B.A. in Anthropology.<ref name=IGN-Paddle-2004>{{cite web|title=Dax Shepard and Matthew Lillard|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2004/08/19/dax-shepard-and-matthew-lillard|work=[[IGN]]|accessdate=November 30, 2013|last=D. |first=Spence|date=August 19, 2004}}</ref> He had a deal with his mother that if he went to college she would pay his rent.<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 />
Shepard has said he wasn't interested in child-acting per se. He was a class clown in school, had a sense he was funny, and wanted to do stand-up. Although he had friends who did stand-up in Detroit, he was too scared. Shepard thought if he moved to California "that commitment would force him to do it."<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 />
== Career == [[File:Dax Shepard at the 2008 Tribeca Film Festival.JPG|thumb|150px|Shepard at the 2008 [[Tribeca Film Festival]] in New York City]] After a year in [[Santa Barbara, California]], Shepard moved to Los Angeles in 1996. He found out about [[The Groundlings]] improv troupe from a friend from Santa Barbara, Kareem Elseify, ended up auditioning (the first time he acted), and took classes while also attending UCLA. After about five years of classes, he got into the Sunday Company of The Groundlings—in a group that included [[Melissa McCarthy]], [[Tate Taylor]] and [[Nat Faxon]].<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 />
From 2003 onwards, Shepard became known from his work in the improv [[Candid Camera]]-type show, ''[[Punk'd]],'' with [[Ashton Kutcher]]. When the show had its 2012 revival, he continued to appear. Shepard said he auditioned for ''[[Punk'd]]'' and while doing the pilot became friendly with Kutcher, who arranged for him to get an agent.<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 /> He auditioned unsuccessfully for 10 years before he landed the role.<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 />
In 2004, Shepard starred in the comedy ''[[Without a Paddle]]'', alongside [[Seth Green]] and [[Matthew Lillard]]. The film received negative reviews but was a commercial success, grossing $69,631,118 worldwide.<ref name=BoxOfficeMojo-Paddle>{{cite web |title=Without A Paddle (2004) |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=withoutapaddle.htm |work=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=September 1, 2009}}</ref> In 2005 he starred as The Astronaut in ''[[Zathura: A Space Adventure]]'', a science fiction adventure fantasy film. In 2006, he appeared with [[Dane Cook]] and [[Jessica Simpson]] in the comedy ''[[Employee of the Month (2006 film)|Employee of the Month]]'' and in Mike Judge's film ''[[Idiocracy]]''.
During the same time, Shepard began appearing in more films and landed his first main character role in ''[[Let's Go to Prison]]'' (2006), alongside [[Will Arnett]] and [[Chi McBride]]. He also had a main role in the 2008 comedy ''[[Baby Mama (film)|Baby Mama]]'', starring opposite [[Tina Fey]] and [[Amy Poehler]]. Shepard wrote the script for the [[Paramount Pictures|Paramount]] venture ''Get 'Em Wet'', in which he again appeared with Arnett. In 2010, he wrote, directed and starred in the low-budget satirical [[mockumentary]] feature ''[[Brother's Justice]]''; the film won an Audience Award at the 2010 [[Austin Film Festival]]. He also had a supporting role in the 2010 [[romantic comedy]] film ''[[When in Rome (2010 film)|When in Rome]]'', which also starred his future wife [[Kristen Bell]].
From 2010 to 2015, Shepard was part of the main cast of the NBC drama ''[[Parenthood (2010 TV series)|Parenthood]]'', playing Crosby Braverman.<ref name=Variety-Parenthood-2009>{{cite news|title=First impressions – "Parenthood"|url=https://variety.com/2009/tv/news/first-impressions-parenthood-18305/|accessdate=September 21, 2014|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=July 6, 2009}}</ref><ref name=Variety-Parenthood-2010>{{cite news|last1=Lowry|first1=Brian|title=Review: ‘Parenthood’|url=https://variety.com/2010/tv/reviews/parenthood-1117942321/|accessdate=September 21, 2014|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=February 25, 2010}}</ref><ref name=HReporter-Parenthood-2014>{{cite news|last1=Goldberg|first1=Lesley|title=NBC Renews 'Parenthood' for Sixth and Final Season|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/nbc-renews-parenthood-sixth-final-703049|accessdate=September 21, 2014|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=May 11, 2014}}</ref> [[File:Kristen Bell Dax Shepard.jpg|thumb|[[Kristen Bell]] and Dax Shepard]] Shepard wrote, produced, co-directed, and starred in the 2012 low-budget film ''[[Hit and Run (2012 film)|Hit and Run]]'' alongside Bell and his close friend [[Bradley Cooper]].<ref name=Variety-HitandRun-2012>{{cite news|last1=Debruge|first1=Peter|title=Review: ‘Hit & Run’|url=https://variety.com/2012/film/reviews/hit-run-1117948082/|accessdate=September 21, 2014|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=August 20, 2012}}</ref><ref name=HReporter-HitandRun-review-2012>{{cite news|last1=DeFore|first1=John|title=Hit and Run: Film Review|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movie/hit-run/review/354965|accessdate=September 21, 2014|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=August 19, 2012}}</ref> He said the movie, which includes numerous car chases and fast driving scenes, allowed him to live out his ''[[Smokey and the Bandit]]'' fantasy.<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 />
Shepard had a supporting role in the 2014 film ''[[The Judge (2014 film)|The Judge]]'', which starred [[Robert Downey Jr.]], [[Robert Duvall]] and [[Vera Farmiga]].<ref name=Vulture-Judge-2014>{{cite news|last1=Buchanan|first1=Kyle|title=Dax Shepard Will Flash His Anus While Acting If That's What It Takes|url=http://www.vulture.com/2014/09/dax-shepard-on-toronto-chips-his-anus.html|accessdate=September 21, 2014|work=[[Vulture (blog)|Vulture]]|publisher=[[New York Magazine]]|date=September 5, 2014}}</ref>
In September 2014, Dax starred with his wife, [[Kristen Bell]], in a commercial for the Samsung Galaxy Tab S.<ref>{{cite web|title=Galaxy Tab S – What You Really Need|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g3Kjj2ca4oQ|website=www.youtube.com/channel/UCnEdfCdbxJJ9ouWKLSRCRRw|publisher=Samsung Mobile USA YouTube|accessdate=December 29, 2014}}</ref> It was so popular (with over 20 million YouTube views) that they did another commercial for the holiday season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Kristen & Dax: Home for the Holidays|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rH-o5JqOXBM|website=www.youtube.com/channel/UCnEdfCdbxJJ9ouWKLSRCRRw|publisher=Samsung Mobile USA YouTube|accessdate=December 29, 2014}}</ref> The ad agency [[McKinney (advertising agency)|McKinney]] was behind both.<ref>{{cite web|title=Samsung work page|url=http://mckinney.com/work/clients/samsung|website=mckinney.com|publisher=McKinney|accessdate=December 29, 2014}}</ref>
Shepard wrote and directed a [[CHiPs (film)|big-screen version]] of ''[[CHiPs]],'' where he starred as Officer Jon Baker alongside [[Michael Peña]] as Frank "Ponch" Poncherello.<ref name=Vulture-Judge-2014 /> The project was released by Warner Bros.<ref name=HReporter-CHiPS-2014>{{cite news|last1=Couch|first1=Aaron|title=Dax Shepard Making 'CHiPS' Movie for Warner Bros.|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/dax-shepard-making-chips-movie-729677|accessdate=September 21, 2014|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=September 2, 2014}}</ref><ref name=IGN-CHiPS-2014>{{cite news|last1=Fowler|first1=Matt|title=Dax Shepard, Michael Peña to Star in CHiPS Movie|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2014/09/03/dax-shepard-michael-pena-to-star-in-chips-movie|accessdate=September 21, 2014|work=[[IGN]]|date=September 3, 2014}}</ref><ref name=AVClub-CHiPS-2014>{{cite news|last1=Modell|first1=Josh|title=Dax Shepard will turn '70s cop show CHiPs into a movie|url=http://www.avclub.com/article/dax-shepard-will-turn-70s-cop-show-chips-movie-208790|accessdate=September 21, 2014|work=[[The A.V. Club]]|date=September 3, 2014}}</ref> on March 24, 2017 to [[CHiPs (film)#Critical response|negative reviews]].
On February 14, 2018 Shepard launched the podcast ''Armchair Expert''. The show explores his well-known guests’ stories. Featured guests on the show have include [[Kristen Bell]], [[Ashton Kutcher]], and [[Joy Bryant]].
== Personal life ==
=== Relationships === Shepard met actress [[Kristen Bell]], also a native of Detroit's northern suburbs, at the birthday party of a mutual friend; they began dating in late 2007. The couple announced their engagement in January 2010.<ref name=USWeekly-Engaged-2010>{{cite web|title=Exclusive: Kristen Bell Is Engaged To Dax Shepard!|work=[[US Magazine]]|date=January 31, 2010 |url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebritynews/news/kristen-bell-is-engaged-to-dax-shepherd-2010311|accessdate=February 1, 2010}}</ref> However, they decided to delay marriage until the state of California passed legislation legalizing [[same-sex marriage]].<ref name=Celebuzz-WontMarry-2012>{{cite web|title='Hit & Run' Couple Kristen Bell and Dax Shepard Won't Marry Until Same-Sex Marriage is Legal in California|url=http://www.celebuzz.com/2012-08-14/hit-run-couple-kristen-bell-and-dax-shepard-on-playing-onscreen-lovers-they-do-mirror-a-portion-of-us/|website=[[Celebuzz]]|accessdate=December 21, 2014|date=August 14, 2012}}</ref> After section 3 of the [[Defense of Marriage Act]] was ruled unconstitutional by the [[U.S. Supreme Court|Supreme Court]] on June 26, 2013, Bell asked Shepard to marry her through Twitter,<ref name=Twitter-KristenProp-2013>{{cite web|title=Kristen proposes to Dax Shepard via Twitter after DOMA falls|work=Twitter|date=June 26, 2013|url= https://twitter.com/IMKristenBell/statuses/349901645343232000/|accessdate=June 26, 2013}}</ref> which he accepted.<ref name=DaxProp-2013>{{cite web|title=Dax Shepard accepts Kristen Bell marriage proposal after DOMA falls.|work=Twitter|date=June 26, 2013|url= https://twitter.com/daxshepard1/statuses/349921536683147264/|accessdate=June 26, 2013}}</ref> They were married at the Beverly Hills County Clerk's Office on October 17, 2013.<ref name=USWeekly-Married-2013>{{cite web|title=Kristen Bell, Dax Shepard Get Married in "No Frills" Wedding at County Clerk's Office|work=[[Us Weekly]]|date=October 17, 2013|url= http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/kristen-bell-dax-shepard-get-married-in-no-frills-ceremony-at-county-clerks-office-report-20131710|accessdate=October 19, 2013|first=Justin|last=Ravitz}}</ref> They have two daughters: Lincoln Bell Shepard (born March 28, 2013)<ref name=People-Lincoln-2013>{{cite web|title=Dax Shepard and Kristen Bell Welcome Daughter Lincoln|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=March 28, 2013|url=http://celebritybabies.people.com/2013/03/28/kristen-bell-dax-shepard-welcome-daughter-lincoln/|accessdate=March 29, 2013}}</ref> and Delta Bell Shepard (born December 19, 2014).<ref name=People-Delta-2014>{{cite web | url=http://celebritybabies.people.com/2014/12/19/kristen-bell-dax-shepard-welcome-daughter-delta/ | title=Dax Shepard and Kristen Bell Welcome Daughter Delta | work=[[People (magazine)|People]] | date=December 19, 2014 | accessdate=December 19, 2014}}</ref>
In January 2012 both were [[veganism|vegan]].<ref name=WomensHealth-vegan-2012>{{cite web |title= Kristen in the Kitchen| url=http://www.womenshealthmag.com/life/kristen-bell-vegan-food |work=[[Women's Health (magazine)|Women's Health]]|date= March 8, 2012|accessdate=March 8, 2012}}</ref> However, he is no longer vegan.<ref name=HReporter-PETA-2013>{{cite web|last=Lewis|first=Hilary|title=Dax Shepard 'Can't Accept' PETA's 'Sexiest Vegetarian' Title Because He Eats Chicken|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/dax-shepard-cant-accept-petas-577262|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=November 30, 2013|date=June 28, 2013}}</ref>
=== Sobriety === Shepard has said that, except for a year in high school when he used drugs (in 1992, leading to the police and his mother getting involved), he did not have a [[substance abuse]] problem until he was 18 years old.<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 /> After many struggles, Shepard got sober in September 2004.<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 />
=== Interests and charity work === Shepard races motorcycles at [[Buttonwillow Raceway Park|Buttonwillow Raceway]], including his [[Ducati Hypermotard]] 1100S and [[Suzuki GSX-R1000]].<ref name=CarCast-2009>{{cite web|last1=Carolla |first1=Adam |title=Dax Shepard |url=http://carcastblog.adamcarolla.com/2009/08/dax-shepard/ |archive-url=https://archive.is/20140921111749/http://carcastblog.adamcarolla.com/2009/08/dax-shepard/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=September 21, 2014 |website=[[CarCast|Adam Carolla's CarCast]] |accessdate=September 21, 2014 |format=audio interview (podcast) |date=August 12, 2009 }}</ref> He donates much of his time to the Hollenbeck Youth Center, an after-school program that provides opportunity to at-risk inner-city youth. He has served as their official Master of Ceremonies, along with his friend [[Tom Arnold (actor)|Tom Arnold]], for the [[Inner-City Games]] and Hollenbeck Youth Center's Miracle on 1st Street Toy Giveaway Program in East Los Angeles.<ref name=MyBoxingFans-Hollenbeck-2008>{{cite web|last1=Chong|first1=Michele|title=Hollenbeck Gym Hosts Toy Giveaway |url=http://myboxingfans.com/2008/12/hollenbeck-gym-hosts-toy-giveaway/|website=MyBoxingFans.com|accessdate=September 20, 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100117203207/http://myboxingfans.com/2008/12/hollenbeck-gym-hosts-toy-giveaway/|archivedate=January 17, 2010|date=December 16, 2008}}</ref><ref name=ContactMusic-Hollenbeck-2014>{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/photos.nsf/main/tom_arnold_5068275 |title=Picture – Tom Arnold and Dax Shepard – Photo 586706 |work=[[Contactmusic.com]] |date=December 15, 2007 |accessdate=April 10, 2014}}</ref>
He is an avid car enthusiast<ref name=PopularHotRodding-Lincoln-2013>{{cite news|last1=Hunkins|first1=Johnny|title=1967 Lincoln Continental – Lincoln Stuntinental|url=http://www.popularhotrodding.com/features/1212phr_1967_lincoln_continental/|accessdate=September 21, 2014|work=[[Popular Hot Rodding]]|date=January 8, 2013}}</ref> and can rebuild an engine (pre-computer). He has a 1967 [[Lincoln Continental]] (which he made the movie ''[[Hit and Run (2012 film)|Hit and Run]]'' about) and races off-road.<ref name=WTF-Maron-2014 />
Shepard and his wife are advocates of no-kids paparazzi.<ref name=HuffPo-NoKidsOpEd-2014>{{cite news |last1=Shepard|first1=Dax|title=Why Our Children Should Be Off Limits to the Paparazzi|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/dax-shepard/only-the-consumer-can-sto_b_4698061.html|accessdate=September 20, 2014|work=[[Huffington Post]]|date=January 30, 2014}}</ref> Bell said: "We're not saying that we can't be newsworthy. We're saying that our child is not newsworthy."<ref name=LATimes-Boycott-2014>{{cite news|last1=Saad|first1=Nardine|title=Kristen Bell, Dax Shepard urge boycott on celebrity kid photos|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/gossip/la-et-mg-kristen-bell-dax-shepard-magazine-boycott-today-20140131-story.html#page=1|accessdate=September 20, 2014|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=January 31, 2014}}</ref> California Senate Bill 606<ref name=CA-SB606-2013>{{cite web|title=Senate Bill No. 606, Chapter 348|url=http://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/billNavClient.xhtml?bill_id=201320140SB606|website=California Legislative Information|accessdate=September 20, 2014|date=September 24, 2013}}</ref> passed in 2013, with testimony by actors [[Halle Berry]] and [[Jennifer Garner]].<ref name=HuffPo-NoKidsOpEd-2014 />
Shepard practices the [[Transcendental Meditation]] program.<ref name=WomensHealth-TM-2013>{{cite news|last1=Majewski |first1=Lori |title=31 things you didn't know about Kristen Bell |url=https://au.lifestyle.yahoo.com/womens-health/life/a/19188973/31-things-you-didnt-know-about-kristen-bell/ |accessdate=December 20, 2014 |work=[[Women's Health (magazine)|Women's Health]] (Australia) |date=October 1, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151002224331/https://au.lifestyle.yahoo.com/womens-health/life/a/19188973/31-things-you-didnt-know-about-kristen-bell/ |archivedate=October 2, 2015 |df=mdy }}</ref>
